adm:managed-object.name: referential-integrity-plugin
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis:
The
maintains referential integrity for DN valued attributes.
adm:managed-object.adm:description: The values of these attributes can reference entries that have been deleted by a delete operation or renamed by a modify DN operation. The referential integrity plug-in either removes stale references to deleted entries or updates references to renamed entries. The plug-in allows the scope of this referential check to be limited to a set of base DNs if desired. The plug-in also can be configured to perform the referential checking in the background mode specified intervals.

adm:property.name: attribute-type
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the attribute types for which referential integrity is to be maintained.
adm:property.adm:description: At least one attribute type must be specified, and the syntax of any attributes must be either a distinguished name (1.3.6.1.4.1.1466.115.121.1.12) or name and optional UID (1.3.6.1.4.1.1466.115.121.1.34).

adm:property.name: base-dn
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the base DN that limits the scope within which referential integrity is maintained.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: Referential integrity is maintained in all public naming contexts.

adm:property.name: log-file
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the log file location where the update records are written when the plug-in is in background-mode processing.
adm:property.adm:description: The default location is the logs directory of the server instance, using the file name "referint".

adm:pattern.adm:synopsis: A path to an existing file that is readable by the server.

adm:property.name: update-interval
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the interval in seconds when referential integrity updates are made.
adm:property.adm:description: If this value is 0, then the updates are made synchronously in the foreground.
